ğŸ“– Vol 4: Remembrance of Death and the Afterlife
A day when you see the earth shaken with its shaking, and the earth brings forth its burdens, then the people will issue forth in groups to see their deeds. A day when the earth and the mountains are carried and crushed with a single crushing, then the Event (Al-Waqi'ah) has occurred and the sky is split, so it is on that day weak, and the angels are on its edges, and the Throne (Arsh) of your Lord is carried above them on that day by eight. On that day you will be presented, nothing hidden from you will be concealed. A day when the mountains will move and you see the earth bare. A day when the earth will be shaken with its shaking and the mountains will be scattered with scattering, so they become scattered dust. A day when the people will be like scattered moths (Al-Farash Al-Mabthuth) and the mountains will be like carded wool. A day when every nursing mother will be distracted from what she nursed, and every pregnant one will deliver her pregnancy, and you see the people intoxicated, yet they are not intoxicated, but the punishment of Allah is severe. A day when the earth will be changed to other than the earth and the heavens, and they will appear before Allah, the One, the Subduer (Al-Qahhar). A day when the mountains will be blown away with blowing, leaving a level plain where you see no crookedness nor unevenness. A day when you see the mountains, you think them fixed, yet they pass like the passing of clouds. A day when the sky is split, so it becomes like red leather. Then on that day, no human or jinn will be asked about his sin. A day when the disobedient will be prevented from speech, and no one will be asked about crimes, but they will be seized by the forelocks and the feet. A day when every soul (Nafs) will find what it did of good present, and what it did of evil, it wishes there were a great distance between it and that. A day when every soul (Nafs) will know what it has brought and will testify to what it sent ahead and left behind. A day when the tongues will be silenced and the limbs will speak. A day whose mention turned gray the Master of the Messengers (Sayyid Al-Mursalin) when the Truthful One (Al-Siddiq), may Allah be pleased with him, said to him: 'I see you have turned gray, O Messenger of Allah.' He said: 'Surah Hud and its sisters have turned me gray [155]'â€”and they are Al-Waqi'ah, Al-Mursalat, 'Amma Yatasa'alun, and 'Idha Al-Shamsu Kuwwirat.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Remembrance of Death and the Afterlife
You have known the terror of the Scale (Mizan) and its danger, and that eyes are staring at the tongue of the Scale: 'So as for he whose scales are heavy, he will be in a pleasing life. And as for he whose scales are light, his mother is HÄwiyah. And what can make you know what that is? It is a Fire, intensely hot.' And know that none is saved from the danger of the Scale except he who accounts in the world his Soul (Nafs) and weighs therein with the scale of the Law (Sharia) his deeds and his words and his thoughts and his glances, as 'Umar, may God be pleased with him, said: 'Account your souls before you are accounted, and weigh them before you are weighed.' And his accounting for his Soul (Nafs) is that he repents from every disobedience before death with a sincere repentance (Tawbah Nasuh) and makes up what he neglected from his shortcomings in the obligations (Fara'id) of God, the Exalted, and returns the wrongs grain by grain, and seeks forgiveness from everyone he wronged with his tongue and his hand and his bad suspicion with his Heart (Qalb), and with the purity of their hearts until he dies and there remains upon him no wrong nor obligation; this one enters the Garden (Jannah) without account.

And know that Allah has a right in the daytime that He does not accept in the night, and Allah has a right in the night that He does not accept in the daytime, and He does not accept the supererogatory (Nawafil) until the obligatory (Fara'id) is performed. And indeed, the scales (Mawazin) of those whose scales are heavy on the Day of Resurrection are heavy because they followed the truth (Haqq) in the world and it was heavy upon them, and it is right for a scale in which nothing is placed except the truth to be heavy. And indeed, the scales of those whose scales are light on the Day of Resurrection are light because they followed falsehood (Batil) and it was light upon them, and it is right for a scale in which nothing is placed except falsehood to be light.
